repo_notes.content: Gaia Sky is a 3D universe visualization platform with support for more than a billion objects.

pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce Gaia Sky, its purpose as a 3D universe visualization platform, high-level architecture, and key features

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through downloading, installing, running Gaia Sky, and understanding basic concepts

pages.title: Installation and Requirements
pages.purpose: Detail system requirements, installation methods (packages, source), and initial setup

pages.title: First Run and Dataset Management
pages.purpose: Explain the welcome screen, dataset manager, downloading catalogs, and launching the application

pages.title: Configuration System
pages.purpose: Explain the config.yaml structure, settings hierarchy, and basic customization

pages.title: Core Architecture
pages.purpose: Describe the high-level architectural patterns: ECS, event system, rendering pipeline

pages.title: Application Lifecycle
pages.purpose: Document GaiaSky and GaiaSkyDesktop classes, initialization sequence, main loop, and shutdown

pages.title: Entity-Component-System (ECS)
pages.purpose: Explain the Ashley ECS architecture, entities, components, systems, archetypes, and families

pages.title: Settings and Event System
pages.purpose: Document the Settings singleton, event manager, 300+ event types, and observer pattern

pages.title: Internationalization (i18n)
pages.purpose: Explain the gsbundle property files, supported languages, and localization system

pages.title: Scene Management
pages.purpose: Deep dive into scene graph, entity lifecycle, camera system, and scene update loop

pages.title: Scene Initialization and Entity Loading
pages.purpose: Document the initialization systems, archetype loading, scene graph building, and entity setup

pages.title: Update Systems
pages.purpose: Explain GraphUpdater, ParticleSetUpdater, OctreeUpdater, and the update phase of the main loop

pages.title: Camera and Focus System
pages.purpose: Document NaturalCamera, camera modes (focus/free/game), IFocus interface, and proximity tracking

pages.title: Particle Sets and Star Rendering
pages.purpose: Explain ParticleSet/StarSet components, asynchronous sorting, TopNBuffer, and proximity loading

pages.title: Data Loading System
pages.purpose: Overview of data providers, catalog formats, and the data ingestion pipeline

pages.title: Dataset Descriptors and Management
pages.purpose: Explain DatasetDesc, DataDescriptor, DataDescriptorUtils, and the server/local descriptor system

pages.title: Data Providers
pages.purpose: Document STILDataProvider, BinaryDataProvider, and other providers for loading catalog files

pages.title: UCD Parser and Column Interpretation
pages.purpose: Explain UCDParser, column classification, and mapping astronomical data to IParticleRecord

pages.title: Particle Record Types
pages.purpose: Document the IParticleRecord hierarchy: Particle, ParticleExt, ParticleStar, ParticleVariable

pages.title: Rendering Pipeline
pages.purpose: High-level overview of the rendering architecture, render modes, and render systems

pages.title: Scene Renderer and Render Modes
pages.purpose: Document SceneRenderer orchestration, IRenderMode implementations (normal, stereo, cubemap, VR)

pages.title: Render Systems
pages.purpose: Explain ModelEntityRenderSystem, BillboardEntityRenderSystem, LineEntityRenderSystem, LabelEntityRenderSystem

pages.title: Material System
pages.purpose: Document MaterialComponent, texture loading (lazy/eager), SVT, cubemaps, and height maps

pages.title: Model and Mesh Rendering
pages.purpose: Explain ModelComponent, IntModelInstance, model initialization, and rendering planets/spacecraft

pages.title: Billboard and Particle Rendering
pages.purpose: Document billboard sets, GPU data streaming, blend modes, and star rendering optimization

pages.title: Shadow Mapping and Lighting
pages.purpose: Explain shadow map render pass, light sources, and environment lighting in ModelComponent

pages.title: Shader System
pages.purpose: Overview of GLSL shaders, shader compilation, and the shader pipeline

pages.title: Tessellation Shaders
pages.purpose: Document tessellation evaluation/control shaders, height mapping, and terrain detail

pages.title: Billboard Shaders
pages.purpose: Explain billboard vertex/fragment shaders, rotation, and texture array sampling
